intro: Veronica tairawhiti, commonly known as the Kāhuwai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Veronica tairawhiti plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird life.
